title.narrative: Strategic Partnership Convening and Convincing Programme Cambodia

description.narrative: pathway 1: Strong civil society organizations are in place that can successfully: undertake damage control and/or limit intended restrictions; claim operational and political space and further expand that space; carry out various forms of L&A on issues of interest – including economic, social, and political justice and equality issues – within their local context and more broadly; and increase their domestic resource base and public accountability. Pathway 4: Increased adherence of the private sector to the UN Guiding Principles on Business & Human Rights.
pathway 1: political space for CSO's and pathway 4; towards a sustainable private sector

title.narrative: Effects political space trade unions and business en human rights

description.narrative: Within the Cambodia country programme of the Civic Engagement Alliance, CNV International and partner organisation CLC are involved in pathway 1 (Political space for CSOs and trade unions) and Pathway 4 (business and human rights). The main focus of the trade union activities will be to improve the labour rights of workers on rubber and sugarcane plantations in Cambodia. Activities that will be implemented are trainings for civil society organizations (including trade unions) on lobby, advocacy and campaigns for respect of human (trade union and labor) rights, training for improved lobby and advocacy skills; Building strategic alliances; Formulation of joint lobby agenda’s; Implementation of research based lobby strategy and (media) campaigns.

title.narrative: # farmer groups / forum members groups / unions that participated in the L&A training

comment.narrative:
(1) 5 Union members from Grandis participated in a L&A training organised by CAWF on Climate Change, Good Governance and the concept Land Law.
"4 target in Q4: (1). Farmer Group from Siem Reap, Svay Rieang, Prey Veng, Sihnouk ville and Kampot provinces. 22 farmer leaders (M:19, F:3). The training facilitated by Mr. Heng Choeurn, No name farmer group. (PW1, #2.2) (2). Union CUFA, at Phnom Penh city attended training on Freedom of association. 16 participants (M:12, F:4). The training and facilitated by Mr. Heng Chouern. (PW4, #3.2) (3). Union Veitnam Kampuchea Enconomy Trade and Industry, at Kratie province. 11 participants (M:8, F:3). Facilitated by Mr. Heng Chouern. (PW4, #3.2) (4). Union Sovan Vuthy at Kratie province. 10 participants (M:4, F:6), faciliatted by Mr. Heng Choueurn. (PW4, #3.2)
Note: In the SP-ICCO Work plan, it don't have specific L&A training, but these session were included at the field Coaching & Strengthening of the Management, Leadership and Decision Making of the existing union leaders. "

No progress training achieved in Q1.
Q2: "Total 11 unions/farmer group that participated in the L&A Training in Q2
Total 10 participation from Farmer Group/Union (Total = 46: M = 31, F = 15): 1. Farmer group from Prey Veng (Total: 9, M: 4, F: 5) 2. Farmer group from Kamport province (Total: 5, M: 4, F: 0) 3. Farmer group from Svay Rieang Province (Total: 5, M: 3, F: 2) 4. Farmer group from Siem Reap Province (Total: 5, M: 4, F: 1) 5. Farmer group from Sihanouk Ville Province (Total: 3, M: 2, F: 1) 6. Union from Socfin (Total: 5, M: 3, F: 2) 7. Union from Grandis (Total: 4, M: 4, F: 0) 8. Union from Sovan Vuthy (Total: 3, M: 3, F: 0) 9. Union from CUFA (Total: 3, M: 2, F: 1) 10. Union from Swiss Resource (Total: 5, M: 2, F: 3) Note: The Full Day Training Course on Leadership, Lobbying and Advocacy and Gender Equality was given to 47 leaders and members of the FAPD and CAWF (CD-Pathway 1-2.2). 2 speakers shared their experiences regarding leadership skills (by Mr. Ath Thorn) and gender issues (by Mrs. Heng Chenda) at the Coffee Culture restaurant, City of Phnom Penh. Training results: Participants have learned about the definition of Leadership and the different ways of Leadership by Management and Leadership, Concept of Lobby and Advocacy and how to apply it to trade unions and associations, as well on Gender issues and Gender Equality in the workplace. This training provided a knowledge and skill to CAWF and FAPD Leaders to use their Leadership roles to lead and manager their members in an effective manner. To encourage local members to make a strategy plan of lobby and advocacy to dialogue with employers. To encourage an initiation of the Gender Committees from local to national level.
Total 1 participation from Union from Swiss Resource Company at Snoul district, Kratie province. (Total = 18, M: 13, F: 5) Note: Conducted a training on labour dispute settlement for workers of SWISS RESOURCE Company. There were 18 workers in total (including 5 females) attended this training that was held at Snual district, Kratie province. During the training participants were trained on how to do complain, how to comply with the procedure of complain and its mechanism both at internal and national level. The Union at SWISS RESOURCE Company just recently formed in February 2019. The demanded to form the union was because the incidence of case that workers had threat by the employers and have no space to dialogue. With the union now workers having confident to do dialogue with the employer on labour rights, labour dispute procedure at company, and as well they are trust union to organize and represent the members.
" Q3: "Total unions/farmer group that participated in the L&A Training in Q3
1). 15 September 2019: 3 Provincial FAPD Leaders from Siem Reap, Prey Veng, and Svay Reang Provinces participated at the National Workshop on Lobby and Advocacy and Social Dialogue led by CLC President, Mr. Ath Thorn at Cambodiana Hotel, Phnom Penh city. The topic of the workshop provided the technical skills and knowledge on Lobby and Advocacy strategy for Leadership. In addition to that, the experience of Social Dialogue has been shared with all the participants. Total 5 farmer group/union (Total:5, M:5, F:0) particiapated L&A and Social Dialogue workshop conducted by CLC and CAWF at Phnom Penh City on 15 September, 2019. 1. Farmer leader from Svay Reang province (Total: 1, M:1) 2. Farmer leader from Prey Veng province (Total: 1, M:1) 3. Farmer leader from Siem Reap province (Total: 1, M:1) 4. Union from Long Met company Kampot province (Total: 2, M:2, F:0)
2). 8 September 2019: Mr. Heng Choeurn, President of CAWF conducted training on Lobby and Advocacy, Dispute Settlement, and Union Management in Mondul Kiri Province for 12 participants (M:9, F:3). Total 4 unions and the participants were coming from Socfin (8), Grandis (1), Swiss Resource (2), and 1 Long Mate (1) Trade Unions at Mondul Kiri Province. The participant has learned the concept of Lobby and Advocacy in Trade Union, Procedure of Dispute Settlement, how to obey the labour law, Trade Union law, effective union management. They were also shared relevant experiences on good practice in union-management amongst each other.
Q4: "3 Total farmer group that participated in the L&A Training
17-18 October 2019: 2 FAPD provincial leaders from Siem Reap learned a lot of experience that they gain on the continuation workshop on National Resource and Land Law with CLEC at Battambang Province. The target community (CLEC Beneficiaries) and Union leaders have learned each other on the national resource, land law and management and study on land dispute cases between company and community group. A lot of community groups and trade unions known each other and build the local network in the community. There are 2 farmers group such as: 1 Farmer group from Thbeng community, Siem Reap province 1 Farmer group from Banteay Srey community, Siem Reap province
10 November 2019: CAWF President organized a local training on the labour rights (LR) and Freedom of Association (FoA) to recruit more members at Long Mate Company with a total of 20 participants (F:3, M:17). The training also used as reflection and to consult union leaders and activists on the labour case (Dismissal of union activist ). During the event, we also developed a letter and submitted a demand letter to Long Mate's employer to find a good solution to reinstatement one of union activists to retune to work at Long Mate Company. The Employer accepts the demand letter from union workers and they will make the appointment meeting afterward. There are 1 union from Long Mate company participated in the L&A training "
"

Q2: "7 union leaders from local unions that participated in the training on CBA: (Total = 22: M: 18, F: 4) 1. Union Grandis, at Kampong Sque province (Total: 3, M: 3, F: 0) 2. Socfin, at Pech Chenda district, Mondul Kirim (Total: 3, M: 2, F: 1) 3. Union CUFA, in Cham Kamoun commune, Boeng Trabiek district, Phnom Penh (Total: 2, M: 2, F: 0) 4. Sovann Vuthy, in Snoul district, Kratie province (Total: 3, M: 1, F: 2) 5. Union Dai Nam, at Pech Chenda district, Mondul Kiri Province (Total: 1, M: 1, F: 0) 6. Vietnam-Cambodia, in the Veitnam Kampuchea Economy Trade and Industry (VKETI) Co.ltd, in Snoul district, Kratie Province (Total: 2, M: 1, F: 0) 7. Union Swiss Resource- Cambodia.Co.Ltd, at Snoul district, Kratie Province (Total: 4, M: 3, F: 1)
Note: On 29 April, 2019: CAWF conducted a training on MRS awareness to leaders of 7 local unions. There were 18 participants in total (including 4 females). Participant were aware of the important of MRS and they were also gain knowledge on how to apply for it to MoLVT. At the end of the training, union leader committed to process of the data collection of relevant documents related to the application requirements, and setup the realistic plan with their own members. (CD, Pathway 4, 1.2).
Most Representative Status (MRS), it is mean all trade unions in a company have rights to apply for it. In the case of a trade union have the amount of member more than other trade unions, then can suggest to the ministry of labor to award MRS certificate. After 30 days submission of the suggestion letter, Ministry of Labor will awarding or informing. When a trade union received a MRS, then it is entitled rights to have collective bargaining (CBA) with employer. In case of one company only has one union, then the union have to have at least 30% supporter out of total worker. If there are 2 or more unions in a company, a union have to have 50% supporters out of total workers.
Q3: "4 farmers groups participated in the training on Communication: (Total = 22: M: 18, F: 4):
1). 2 farmer group from Sam Roung commune and Roum Deng Commune. 4-5 September 2019: CLC President, Mr. Ath Thorn conducted a follow-up meeting to strengthen the potential member at Prey Veng (farmer group from Sam Roung Community) and Svay Reap (farmer group from Roum Deng Community) Provinces and attended by FAPD members with a total of 70 participants (F:25, M:44). The field meeting has improved the internal communication between national to provincial FAPD structure, to set up the strategy to recruit new members, to strengthen the role and responsibility of FAPD leader. Besides that, there were some relevant experiences of farmer group’s leaders that have been shared as a lesson learned, good practice.
2). 1 farmer groups (from Thbeng Community, Banteay Srey District, Siem Reap Province). 29 August 2019: Mr. Heng Choeurn, conducted a field visit to the existing farmer group at Thbeng Community, Banteay Srey District, Siem Reap Province. The field meeting was attended by 22 participants (F: 11, M: 11). The meeting has discussed on the issue of relevant farmer rights, land rights, and land dispute case between farmer and Agriculture Company. Farmer leaders and activists then have a clear understanding of their roles and responsibilities in FAPD structure and on how to further improve of the internal communication between leaders and farmer groups.
3). 1 Local union at LONG MATE, CHHOUCK District: 21-22 July 2019: CAWF provided training of basic union rights and communication to Long Mate workers (Banana Plantation Company) at Chhuck District, Kampot Province and participated by 36 farmers/workers with F:16, M:20. Majority of the worker was aware of the basic union rights, how was important to organize the union and how to use the communication tools in the trade union structure. During the training, workers interested to establish a new trade union there. They then established the union and elected 4 leaders and 6 activists and also selected for Position of President, Vice-President, Secretary and Treasurer.
Q4: "Total 14 farmer group/union participated in the training on communication 9 December 2019: Mr. Heng Choeurn, President of FAPD organized a national workshop on land rights and farmer rights and as well as the 3rd congress FAPD with total 28 members from provincial FAPD (F:6, M:22). A Full day workshop and congress has share relevant knowledge on land law, basic farmer right, review progression report in the last mandate, approve on the strategy 4 years for FAPD and also electing the new candidate for FAPD leaders for new mandatory. The result, all FAPD leaders understood land law in Cambodia, rights to organize the community, the 4-years strategy planning for FAPD has approved by the congress and new 6 candidates was elected by FAPD members. 13 farmers group from 5 Provinces as such: 3 farmers groups from Krom 18, Sihanouk Ville province 2 farmers groups from Krom 19, Sihanouk Ville province 3 farmer groups from Prey Khoum community, Kampot Province 1 farmer group from Raksmey Kamoub community, Kampot Province 2 farmer group from Phum Morm community, Kampot Province 2 farmer group from Ta Mov community, Prey Veng Province 2 farmer group from Phum Veal community, Prey Veng Province 1 farmer group from Phum Thlouk community, Prey Veng Province 1 farmer group from Rom Deng community, Svay Reang Province 2 farmer group from Chhunk Sor community, Svay Reang Province 2 farmer group from Cham Kachek community, Svay Reang Province 1 farmer group from Prey Thnong community, Svay Reang Province 5 farmer group from Chhouk Preng community, Siem Reap Province
10 November 2019: CAWF President organized a local training on the labour rights and Freedom of association attempt to recruit more member at Long Mate company with total:20 participants, (F:3, M:17). The training has reflected to consult union leaders and activist on the labour case (Dismissal of union activist) and then, they submitted demand letter to Long Mate employer find a good solution to reinstatement one of union activist retune to work at Long Mate Company. The Employer accept the demand letter from union workers and they will make the appointment meeting afterward. 1 Union from Long Mate company with 20 union members."
"
"

title.narrative: # and kind of (public and private, Tus and CSO's) stakeholders attending multisectoral dialogue

comment.narrative: (1) 1 for new trade union law concerning at national assembly and MoLVT (2) 1 at AC on system dispute resolution meeting and (3) 1 meeting with the NGOs partner on new trade union law discussion and other cooperation work (4) Joint petition on agriculture workers issue with CLC and NGOs partners on Labour Day 2017 (5) Meeting on court case with farmer group at Siem Reap

No changes as compared to Q2: (1) Joint statement to the government on the National Social Security Fund: ILO, GMAC, CENTRAL, Ministry of Labour and Vocational Training, Labour Advisory Committee (NB this result has also been included in the SP FWF and TUCP!). (2) Joint petition on agricultural workers' issues on Labour Day, 2018: All leaders of farmers groups, CLC management committee of Labour Day, C.CAWDU (3) Consultation on draft minimum wage law: Leaders of union, Ministry of Labour and Vocational training, ILO, ACILs, CENTRAL and GMAC (NB this result has also been included in the SP FWF and TUCP!). (4) Comment on draft new regulation (Prakas) related to amendment of trade union law: ILO, GMAC, ACILs, CENTRAL, other independent Union
"3 target in Q4: (1). Meeting on (Submision) Proposal letter on Union register and Social Protection ID to Department of Labour at Kratie. The Concerning letter on unon register and social protection has submitted to department of labour. Participation from CAWF leaders, Union Socfin, and Labour department officer. The meeting purpose is get access registering union and bring social protection service for union workers. No name of multisectoral dialogues it's just unoffical meeting with provical goverment. (2). Radio talk show on FoA in Plantation sector and promote Social Dialouge. The radio talk show is kind of media publication to promote social dialogue and lobby action to goverment and employer to aware on worker right in plantation. Media broadcasted in VOD station 105 Mz, Facebook page CLC, and Wedsite. (3). Submitted Concerning letter on Agriculture workers to Goverment: CLC affiliate federations (CAWF, FAPD, CIWF, BWTUC, CTSWF, CTWF, C.CAWDU, and CIWA), and other CSOs as Cambodian Center for Human Rigths, and Equitable of Cambodia jointed concerning lettter submit to Prime- Minister and Ministry of Labour. The purpose is raising concerning issue on social protection and worker right in all sector."

Q1: "2 for Pathway 1: 1). Radio talkshow on the farmer right and land dispute case between farmer group and local autherity at Sihanouk ville province (LL No 1.2) 2). Joint statement call for release 1 land activist andy 1 regional volunteer at Sihanouk ville (LL no 1.3)
"
Q2: No target achived untill Q2
Q3: "(1) "(1) (CAWF has jointed in 1 multi-sectoral dialogue with CTSWF (Construction, Tourism, and Transportation sectors), BWTUC (Building and Wood Workers Trade Union Federation of Cambodia) and CLC to submitted the petition to Ministry of Labour on the common issue relating to Labour contract - Eliminate the sort-term contract (FDC) and change to Long-term contract (UDC), Social Protection System, Minimum Wage Demand of 300$ for monthly minimum wage and Right to organizing a union in the agriculture sector.
"
Q4: "1). 26 November 2019: Mr. Heng Choeurn, President of FAPD jointed a called meeting with the National Senate of Cambodia on the amendment of new Trade Union Law. The meeting has reviewed the amendment proposed by the trade union in each sector and discussed the detail of 16 articles on trade union law which are commonly issued by trade unions. The result, H.E Mrs. Man Samart, the 8th Committee at the national senate listened to the amendment proposal by representing trade unions and she promised to federations to discuss this matter further with the legal team and also submitted the proposal to the president of the senate in Cambodia.
2). 5 November 2019: CAWF conducted a dialogue meeting with the Labour inspector of the Provincial Department at Kampot Province with Total: 5 participants (M: 5, F: 0). The meeting has discussed on Long Mate case (Dismissal of union activist). At the same time, CAWF also built trust between the union and local government. The provincial department officer extended their commitment to collaborate and share further information on the labour case to their top line.
"
"

title.narrative: # meetings within the region in which the unions bargain for the labour conditions of their members

comment.narrative: (1) CAWF conducted legal consultation with Union member at Grandis, (2) Submitted labour case to employer at Grandis, (3) Negotiated Grandis employer about dismissed case 124 workers.

(1) Consulation meeting with union member at Grandis company on labour case, (2) Legal advise related to labour case in Chhun Hong company, (3) Discussion meeting on Socfin case to develop the demanding, (these 2 cases still pending for resolution until this period)
"2 meeting in Q4: (1). Lobby meeting on labour rights and FoA with commune chiefs at Kratie. District/Commune chiefs, understood about Freedom of association/rigth to organizing, role of CAWF and labour rigths in plantation sectors and they committee to work with CAWF. (2). Conciliation meeting with Ministry of Labour on union CUFA Labour dispute. In the process discussion with Abitration Council stage that focused on case dismissal 11 union workers (no result).
Note: #1 and #2 be able to list in the meeting, due to these meeting are relate to bargain meeting with local government and Abitration Council."

No meeting progress achived to bargining the labour case in Q1
Q2: "There are 10 meetings within the regions:
CAWF conducted 5 times strengthening meetings with leaders of a local unions of Socfin, Dainam, Sovan Vuthy, and Vietnam- Cambodia and Grandis Company. Note: The Leaders of the union raised the challenges and identified strategy that they have to confronted, such as: providing legal services, mobilizing more members, collecting membership and prepared annual progress report for submitting to the Ministry of Labour & Vocational Training in accordance with the law on trade union (Between 6-7- 8-26 April, and 9 June 2019).
6). CAWF President, Mr. Chueon had a meeting with employer of SWISS RESOURCE Company and local authority– communal police officer in Snual district, Kratie province. To informed to the police and employers in regards of purpose and giving the understanding of CAWF Activities at the company level.The company and police agreed and allowed CAWF.
7). CAWF conducted an intervention activity by providing awareness meeting regarding freedom of association and rights to assembly especially rights to organize workers. There were 20 workers and activists at SWISS RESOURCE company joint the meeting and aware of their rights to participate with unionization activities.
8). Mr. Ath Thorn leaded a field meeting, to strengthening role and responsibility of FAPD leader and activists with 35 farmers (16 of them are women) at Preak Treing Beach, Sihanouk Ville Province. During the meeting, some relevant experiences of leader farmer group have been shared as lesson learnt, good practice and also to reviewed the structure of the Provincial FAPD leaders with the farmer groups’ members (In 31 May 2019).
9). Mr. Heng Choeurn, President of FAPD organized a new community group at Snoul District, Kratie Province with 40 farmers (22 of them are women). The meeting introduced the important of Farmer Association of Peace and development (FAPD) and farmer rights to join in the association. In the meeting 20 farmers understood farmer rights and the benefits to joint FAPD (In 9 June 2019).
10). CAWF have submitted an official reconciliation letter to CUFA Company and made an appointment meeting to joint a dialogue with employer and trade union. The stakeholder meeting has been done between Union, Arbitration Council (AC) and Employer (CUFA Company) to trackle the issue of dismissal of 14 workers without compensation payment and retention fund from company since 2008. Arbitration Council (AC) ordered to CUFA to pay compensation and retention fund to all 14 workers but the company is still rejected to the AC requests. CAWF then decided to continue to make complaint to the Court. "
Q3: "There are 10 meetings within the regions as follows:
FAPD (Farmer Association of Peace and Development) conducted 4 meetings: 1). 11 July 2019: Mr. Heng Choeurn conducted an organizing a new farmer community at Chivat Village, Snoul District, Kratie Province with 10 total farmers (M: 4, F: 6). The meeting has discussed among the farmer's group on workers’ rights, labour issues and right to organize farmers in the community. In addition to that, FAPD leaders motivated farmer group to join the FAPD, however, the farmer group still hesitated to join the FAPD. Since less its participation from the farmer group, then it will be discuss to the next meeting for establishing a farmer group. 2). 4-05 September 2019: CLC President, Mr. Ath Thorn conducted a follow-up meeting to strengthen the potential member at Prey Veng and Svay Reap Provinces and attended by FAPD members with a total of 70 participants (F:25, M:44). The field meeting has improved the internal communication between national to provincial FAPD structure, to set up the strategy to recruit new members, to strengthen the role and responsibility of FAPD leader. Besides that, there were some relevant experiences of farmer group’s leaders that have been shared as a lesson learned, good practice. 3). 6 September 2019: Mr. Heng Choeurn, President of FAPD conducted a field visit to coaching leaders of farmer groups in Ou Bay Community, Snoul District, Kratie Province. It was attended by a total of 45 participants (F: 10, M: 35). The field coaching provided a clearer understanding of the farmer rights, the role of farmers and FAPD current structure and new members. Farmer leaders then committed to recruiting more farmers in the community to joint FAPD and improving self-capacity to do a lobby to local government and middle man/employer. 4). 29 August 2019: Mr. Heng Choeurn, conducted a field visit to the existing farmer group at Thbeng Community, Banteay Srey District, Siem Reap Province. The field meeting was attended by 22 participants (F: 11, M: 11). The meeting has discussed on the issue of relevant farmer rights, land rights, and land dispute case between farmer and Agriculture Company. Farmer leaders and activists then have a clear understanding of their roles and responsibilities in FAPD structure and on how to further improve of the internal communication between leaders and farmer groups.
CAWF (Cambodian Agriculture Workers Federation) conducted 6 meetings: 1). 12 July 2019: Mr. Heng Choeurn, conducted a field organizing at Sovan Reachsey, Kratie, Snoul District Rubber and Banana Plantation Company with total of 13 workers (F:5, M:8) participated. The meeting was to explain about trade union rights, worker/labor rights, and the importance of a trade union and labour dispute settlement, as well to introduce CAWF mission/vision. Most of the workers were aware of a trade union, labour law and worker’s right. They were also showed interest to a joint at union but they suggested to CAWF to do another meeting and can be used to discuss more on how to establish the union since there were only fewer workers participation during the meeting. 2). 23 July 2019: CAWF President conducted preparation meeting on register union certification at Long Mate Company in Kampot Province with the participation of union leaders and activists. It was attended by about 7 participants (M: 6, F: 1). Most of the union leaders fully engaged in the process of registration and have completed the requirements technically assisted by CAWF. The result was the union member has signed and gave thumbprint on the union register format and have submitted union register format to the Department of Labour and Vocational training at Kampot Province. The government agreed to accept the registration proposal from the trade union that formally registered on 1st of August 2019. The official certification of the trade union has been issued and recognized in Long Mate Company, Kampot Province. 3). 13 August 2019: Mr. Heng Choeurn has conducted a field coaching to strengthen the roles and responsibilities of trade unions in Long Mate Company, Kampot Province with the participation of union leaders, activists, and members (total 40 with F:17, M: 23). The meeting provided information on the CAWF principle, shared good practices with other sectors such as Minimum Wage negotiation, law and policy adjustment and lobby and advocacy activity. The result were trade union leaders, activist, and members have ownership in leading the union activity and they have the confidence to recruit about 150 additional new members participated in the Long Mate trade Union. 4). 21-22 September 2019: CAWF Leaders provided the legal consultation and strengthening of the labour dispute settlement to union leaders and members at Long Mate company, Kampot Province with Total of 58 participants (M:28, F:30). There is one dismissal case of 1 unionist at Long Mate Company. The person was dismissed as he is very active in collecting new members at the company. He was terminated in the Banana Plantation since last August. The meeting has strengthened the legal procedure, relevant labour law. In addition to that, an appointment letter has been submitted to the employer and a call for negotiation has been demanded to discuss and lobby to reinstate the unionist to the former position. 5). 13-17 July 2019: CAWF continued to organize a meeting to strengthening the labour case on dismissal a union leader at VIETNAM-Cambodia, Kratie Province with union leaders and activists (Total: 5, M: 4, F: 1). The meeting has provided the technical consultation on the procedure of legal settlement and fact-finding cases and arrange the complaint case letter with the signature/thumb-print by a trade union. The result was CAWF submitted a complaint letter to DoLVT and call for good solution. The VIETNAM-Cambodia employer agreed to union proposal and allow 1 of union leader reinstatement. 6). 13, 18, 31 August 2019: Mr. Heng Choeurn, President of CAWF conducted 3 times lobbies with DoLVT officer at Kampot Province. The meeting has built a good relationship with each other, such as introducing the trade union and labour right, registration of trade union procedure and right to organize the union. The government officer then understood each other and they committed to have good cooperation, sharing relevant information regarding unions.
Q4: "There are 6 times meeting within the region as following: 1). 29 October 2019: Mr. Heng Choeurn, President of CAWF led a field coaching and strengthening the labor rights and union rights to Long Mate Union leaders and activists with total: 20 participants (F:6, M:14). The field coaching has discussed relevant issue happened in Long Mate Company and union leaders developed their own strategy to recruit new members. The result, there are 20 additional new members joined the union and they prepared a support document as the member list to collect membership dues . 2). 6 December 2019: CAWF lead a field visit to organized and strengthen members at Sovan Reachsey, Kratie Province with a total of 20 participants (M: 9, F: 11). The field visit to review the role and responsibilities of the local trade union leaders, activists and the general principles of local trade union work. The result, 4 union leaders and activists understood more about the union structure and role of leader. They committed to recruiting new activists and members to have strong solidarity from their members. 3). 30 December 2019: CAWF Leader conducted a field organizing new members at Dai Nam Company, Snoul District, Kratie Province with total: 20 (M: 8, F:12). The Meeting has reviewed the specific role and duty of union leaders and activists in order to increase more members and capacity building on basic union rights to new workers. The discussion has reached to increase knowledge on union rights and the right to organize members. 10 union leaders and activists extend their commitment to recruiting more members in the next plan. 4). 9-11 September 2019: CAWF conducted a local union election and established a new trade union at Sovan Reachsey, Kratie Province, Snoul District Rubber and Banana Plantation company with a total of 7 union leaders and activists (F:1, M:6). The meeting has discussed processing union registration. And they finally submitted the union registration letter to the provincial department of labour in Kratie province . 5). 24 November 2019: CAWF and Local Trade Union jointed a Round Table Meeting with Long Mate Company to demand the reinstatement of union activists with a total of 8 participants, (M:1, F:6). CAWF provided relevant information and evidence to convince the employer company. At the moment, employers still rejected the union proposal by their reason, workers left the work without informing to company . 6). 19 December 2019: The president of CAWF organized a legal strengthening meeting with Long Mate union leaders and activists’ with total of 20 participants, (M: 9, F: 11). The meeting has consulted the legal case and discuss the next step on how to reinstate one of the union activists and sharing information on how to collect and managing the member pay due. The result, CAWF has submitted the member list pay due to employer and employer agreed to cut the worker pay due through monthly salary deposit "
"

title.narrative: # of farmers groups, unions and alliances trained by CSO's and NGO's on L&A

comment.narrative: (1,2,3) 3 people (1 from Mondolkiry province and 2 from Kampong Spue province) 3 people of 3 groups training/trainers (4) Farmer group at Siem Reap (5) Farmer group at Prey Veng (6) Farmer group at Svay Rieang provinces attended L&A awareness

1 (15) Alliance members from Apheda, 2 (5) Union members from Grandis company, 3 (12) Farmer groups at Siem Reap, Kampot, Svay Rieang, and Prey Veng province, Yes it's double recode. But 12 Farmer group at it's new group.

No progress achived in Q1 period: the CEA partners planing for L&A training in Q2 by CLEC
Q2: "2 union/farmer group trained on L&A by CSO (M: 3. F: 0): 1. From CAWF: Mr. Heng Choeurn. 2. From FAPD: Mr. Chan Rithy, FAPD Leader from Siem Reap province and Mr. Haun Ravuth, FAPD from Seim Reap province.
Note: From 14-16 June 2019, 1 CAWF and 2 Provincial FAPD leaders attended 3 days community training on Land law management, National resource management, Human Right and Advocacy skills conducted by Community Legal Education Center (CLEC) - CEA alliance at Mondul Kiri Province. The training have provided basic skills and knowledge on Land crape prevention by the plantation company, fact finding report by CLEC, and win-win lobby strategy by community. " Q3: "Total 3 CAWF Leaders who has trained by NGO (CLEC) on L&A.
27-28 August 2019: 3 CAWF Union Leaders from Socfin Company have attended the reflection workshop on National resource and Community Land rights issues at Siem Reap Province. The workshop conducted by CLEC-ICCO Alliance. The CAWF trade union has learned on the national resource, land law and management and study on land dispute cases between company and community group. A lot of community groups and trade unions known each other and build communication through making contract lists and Facebook users for further share experience on the relevant issues on land rights and worker rights. " Q4: "Total 2 FAPD Leaders who has trained by NGO (CLEC) on L&A.
17-18 October 2019: 2 FAPD provincial leaders from Siem Reap learnt a lot of experience gain on the continue the workshop on national resource and land law with CLEC at Battambang Province. The target community (CLEC Beneficiaries) and Union leaders have learned each other on the national resource, land law and management and study on land dispute cases between company and community group. A lot of community groups and trade unions known each other and build local network at community. There are 2 farmers group such as: 1 Farmer group from Thbeng community, Siem Reap province 1 Farmer group from Banteay Srey community, Siem Reap provincee"

title.narrative: # of cases where companies consulted farmers groups, alliances or unions in designing CSR programs

comment.narrative: (1) Grandis company: ongoing consultations with employer. Other involved stakeholders include CLC legal team and the Provincial Department of Labour and Vocational Training (PoLVT) (2) Socfin company: ongoing case. CAWF is trying to set a meeting with the company representative. Involved stakholders include CAWF, CLC legal team, PoLVT. (3) Chhun Hong company: case successfully solved. Stakeholders included the farmers representative, CLC legal team, PoLVT and the Arbitration Council. The company decided to give an indemnisation to the farmers in compliance with the national law.
3 people of 3 groups training/trainers, (4) Farmer group at Siem Reap, (5) Farmer group at Prey Veng, (6) Farmer group at Svay Rieang provinces attended L&A awareness.
No progress achuved in this period Q1

title.narrative: # CBA negotiation meetings for CBA bargaining in factories/MNC's

comment.narrative: CAWF still processing new union certification so there is no CBA bargaining yet this period

No target achived untill Q1: CLC is still in process of re-registration/recognition (revised Trade Union law). New Trade Union law are require to re-register all union and union bank registation, At least 30% total member in the company to negotiate for Most representative Statue (MRS), and Fully pay membership fee to became MRS, and (3) Union should have validity of union certification.
Q3: "No target achived untill Q3
"

No target untill Q4: CLC is still in process of re-registration/recognition (revised Trade Union law). New Trade Union law are require to re-register all union and union bank registation, At least 30% total member in the company to negotiate for Most representative Statue (MRS), and Fully pay membership fee to became MRS, and (3) Union should have validity of union certification.

title.narrative: # of cases where government offices consult farmers groups, alliances or unions in formulating policies on RB

comment.narrative:
2 cases: (1). Labour case discussion meeting with Ministy of Labour on CUFA Unions negotiation. Dismissal case of 11 union workers at CUFA, and involved by union, company and goverments to make judgement on equal pay, work compensation and Seniority pay to workers. (2). Socfin plantation company in Cambodia, Mondul Kiri province case negotiation with Ministry: Dismisal case of 1 union leader at Socfin and result on processing talk with ministry of labour and Abitration Council for justiciable.
The 2 meetings above was initiated and appointed by ministry. 1). The labour case at CUFA in Cham Kamoun commune, Boeng Trabiek District, Phnom Penh. The Abitration Council has adopted to decision union's proposal and ordered to the employer to pay all the demand. 2) Case at Socfin, Ministry has adopted to the union proposal but employer still rejected to the ministry's decision.
No change in this period
No progress achuved in this period Q1

title.narrative: # of new or revised laws/policies with labour conditions themes

comment.narrative:
(1) Revised Trade Union Law, (2) Draft new law on the national social security fund
"Notification on promoting Cooperation between Goveremnt, Civil Sociatey and Associations.: Notification Letter No. 040 issued by Ministry of interior to improve cooperative between CSOs and Government body. This is the new policy enforment on cooperative action of government body from national to sub-national level to improve strong cooperation with Trade Union and CSOs to make space for worker rights protection in society."

No new or revision laws/policy on labour condition themes untill this Q1
Q2: "1 revised law No. 050 on Determination of Employment Contract to Clarification on Fix Duration Contract (FDC) and Probation employment contract for all sectors by Ministry of Labour.
This revised law was initiated by government and employer to extent the period of the Fix Duration Contract (FDC) from 2 to 4 years (revised) under FDC contract.
This result is not contributed directly by CLC/CAWF/FAPD. However, CLC role was to debate for the revised law to prevent and protect the worker rights. This revised law is seek to be lost benefit to trade union, especially to the Fix Duration Contract (FDC) contract could dismissal trade union member everytime and then employer could be able to control union movement in the company level. "
Union registration revised for more easy access
